duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with ASIC design engineers to incorporate testability features into the chip design.
Develop test methodologies, strategies, and test patterns for validating the ASIC.
Create hardware for package and wafer test systems, utilizing the Advantest 93K test platform.
Write test programs for characterization and production testing.
Execute test programs on the ASIC chips and analyze the test results.
Assess the effectiveness and coverage of the developed test strategies and patterns.
Investigate and diagnose failures or defects found during testing using various diagnostic techniques and tools.
Assist in the verification of the ASIC chip design by developing and executing specific test cases or simulations.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design engineers, product managers, and test managers, to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the testing and development lifecycle.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field (minimum requirement)
